meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by excessive static electricity.
meanings.sent1: The hyperstatic balloon stuck to the wall due to the excess static electricity.
meanings.sent2: The hyperstatic clothes clung to each other because of the extra static electricity.
meanings.sent3: The hyperstatic hair made her look like she had just seen a ghost!
meanings.sent4: The hyperstatic atmosphere crackled with energy, like a storm waiting to strike.
meanings.sent5: The hyperstatic shock from the doorknob was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Having an excessive amount of static electricity.
meanings.sent1: The hyperstatic blanket sparked when she touched it.
meanings.sent2: The hyperstatic cat's fur stood on end from all the static electricity.
meanings.sent3: The hyperstatic socks made her feet feel like they were dancing.
meanings.sent4: The hyperstatic room felt charged with unseen energy.
meanings.sent5: The hyperstatic balloon clung to the ceiling, defying gravity.

meanings.definition: Experiencing an excessive amount of static electricity.
meanings.sent1: She felt hyperstatic every time she touched a metal surface.
meanings.sent2: The hyperstatic child's hair crackled with static electricity.
meanings.sent3: The hyperstatic situation made everyone laugh as they tried to touch each other.
meanings.sent4: The hyperstatic environment buzzed with unseen forces at play.
meanings.sent5: The hyperstatic shock made her jump back in surprise.
